Replies.Reply: I won't kill you. I want you to do me a favor.
Tell your friends. Tell all your friends.
GET IN THE CAR!
Ignition!
I called them.
He won't kill her.
GODDAMMIT!
Too many people. Come on!
SHIELDS!!
How much do you weigh?
HANG ON!
Whatever happens -- DON'T LET GO!!
... Not even a 'thank you'?
That's because you lied about your weight.
Thank you.
I'll have to ask you for that film.
Please.
The Joker is a murderer. And you were as good as dead. So --
All right, here's a compromise. I'll develop the photos. You keep the Jokers and I'll keep the rest.
Because I'll take you with me.
Thank you, Vicki.
Shields open.
Ignition.
STOP!
Quite a while. I took the scenic route.
Garage door.
Better. It's not on the market yet.
That's why I wear a target on my chest.
Stumbled across it when I was a boy.
They don't come down here. They're afraid of the lights.
They used to terrify me. But I forced myself to keep coming back, and --
-- I guess I became the thing I feared the most. I'll do your photos now.
I have sponsors.
I'm running a check on the tainted products. There is a pattern.
I've tracked all the records. Every shipment, every warehouse, every loading dock. Nothing. No opportunities for tampering. Somehow the Joker is supplying tainted ingredients... at the source.
Oh, no. I let the FBI do that. Then I tap into the FBI. -- Your photos are ready.
I had to save you, Vicki.
Here you go. I think I'll let you keep the whole set.
Care for an autograph?
Are you talking to me?
Maybe we've had enough for one night. I'll take you home.
Do you want to do it this time?
Don't be afraid. I'm here.
Take me. Let the boy go.
What are you talking about?
How did you...
The Joker. Is he --?
DICK!
Mad... man...
... Murderer...
For God's sake, Harold, can we please just get a taxi??
I'm trying to get a --
TAXI!!
Put that away. We'll look like tourists.
We'll never get a cab here. Let's cut over to Seventh.
I know where we are!
We're going the wrong way.
Seventh is that way.
Hey, mister. Gimme a dollar?
HOLD IT!
Honey -- I'm home!
She's outside the Fluegelheim.
Jack?
Yo.
Mister. How about it. One dollar?
One dollar, man. Are you deaf?
Do the kid a favor, lady. Don't scream.
All right. The Gold Card.
Don't leave home without it.
Replies.Didascalie: (tossing the credit card in EDDIE's face)

Replies.Reply: What, scared of heights?
Look, Johnny Gobs got ripped and walked off a roof, all right? No big loss.

No shit. It was all over the pavement.

No wonder you're such a chickenshit.
Do you want this money or don't you? Now shut up! Shut up --
I'm gettin' outta here.
Don't kill me... don't kill me...
A bat, I tell you, a giant bat!
Let's beat it, man. I don't like being up here.
I dunno, man. After what happened to Johnny Gobs --
That ain't what I heard. That ain't what I heard at all.
I heard the bat got him.
Five stories, straight down. There was no blood in the body.
There was no blood, man.
My brother says... all the bad things you done... they come back and haunt you...
My brother's a priest, man.
You shouldn'ta turned the gun on that kid, man. You shouldn'ta --
... it is no longer enough to go after the small-time punks and petty criminals who infest the streets of Gotham City. Crime and corruption must be attacked at the root!
If elected, my first act as district attorney will be to return an indictment against Boss Carl Grissom!
Together we can make Gotham city a safe place for decent people to live and work and play.
How's your luck, Jim?
Mr. Knox, I think we have enough real problems in this city without worrying about ghosts and goblins and Halloween characters.
... We deal.
Screw that, Ed. We've got a market panic of national proportions.
We'll send a team into Ace the moment the warrant comes through.
All right, Bruce, what do you suggest?
Good. A bomb. On a blind tip from Bruce Wayne. -- We do have laws.
We've told him we'll deal. What could he possibly have to gain by --
I don't know. I'm just a D.A. I don't have access to all your expert sources.
Decent people shouldn't live here.
Anything new?
If Grissom knew about us... he might kill you.
You look just fine, Jack.
... The rent? Paid?
Jack? Who was that?
You said I could look at the pictures before you -- before you --
I thought you ought to know -- he's coming for you...
The usual gas. If this clown could lay a hand on Grissom... I would've had to kill him by now.

And besides, he doesn't know.
... I didn't ask.
You didn't show up.
I'm sure that was vitally important.
Eckhardt... our problems are your problems.

You're a smart boy, Eckhardt. You should be thinking about the future.

Here. Use mine.
It's all right, boys. Lt. Eckhardt here is a good cop. A real good cop.
We can always pop him. -- Or pop someone close to him.
"Industrial espionage."
Why do you need me to handle a simple break-in?
I understand.
Mirror.
Mirror.
It's me. "Sugar Bumps."

YOU SET ME UP!
Over a girl. You must be insane!
Keep your hands on the desk.

I'm not a Jack any more.
HA! That's the best part. I CAN'T!!

Nothing out of the routine.
No comment. Print what you like.

I'm doing the best I can. If it's a problem --
I'll work on it.
I answer to Grissom, punk. Not to you.
Ambition.

They found him hugging a drainpipe.

... anonymous tip. Tonight. The Ace Chemical Company.
Lt. Eckhardt, sir.

Good answer. I'm gonna put you in for a commendation.

No offense, boys, but these guys are seeing something up there.

If so, is he on the police payroll?
What have you got for me, Jerry?
Nice, but... maybe a little more gore on the fangs, huh?

... Vicki Vale.
Honey -- I would know any randomly selected square inch of Vicki Vale.
If I had a good enough hint.
Where the hell have you been?
God, a girl could get hurt doing this.
Got any more of those?
It's too good, Vick. We got a six-
Small so far. I mean -- they don't allow bats in boardrooms, do they.
Yeah. Hottest ticket in town. Every law'n'order freak in the city's gonna be there.

Aw, Vicki. Vicki!
Got a date?
Vicki, baby, I love you, I've always loved you. Will you marry me?
Well, I'm starving. Will you at least buy me a hamburger?
How high up would you say that is?
You know, if you cut your bathroom in half, you'd have my apartment.
The small one.
Man, I feel like Robin Leach. You actually know all these people?
Yeah, I guess we move in different circles. -- Though I did meet a one-eyed pimp last week.
Commissioner Gordon! What do you hear from our pointy-eared friend?
Aww, Commissioner. There's gotta be one honest cop in Gotham city.
Mr. Dent. What's your stand on winged vigilantes?
My question is, where does one man get all this junk.
Holy shit...
... We found the arsenal.
This guy has just gotten interesting. What else do you know?
Likes to kill?
I bet they like him for his big charity balls.
Well, you know me. The more they've got, the less they're worth.
This guy must be the most worthless man in America.
I assume in my usual charming manner I've just insulted the host.
Alexander Knox.
Great. Give me a grant.
"This is Miss Vale." -- That felt redundant.
Some people think she has two.
I know the rich are different, but that guy is real different.
Hello? Vicki?
What were you thinking?
Well, he must like the way he looks. He's got a mirror in every room.
Commissioner. Do us both a favor.
Vick! Looks like our friend the bat is getting ambitious. -- Why the dopey grin?

HEY MIRANDA! C'MERE!
I want you to pay close attention to this. Miranda -- tell my friend here what you told me about Bruce Wayne.
Yeah. "Mister One-Nighter."
Because that's the average length of his relationships with women.
Tell her about the peanuts.
Yeah. Peanuts. Which is how he goes through women.
Why?
Aw, come on, Vicki, I'm a reporter.
... What was that?

...Peanut.
Come on. Gimme some dirt!
... Why don't you like your picture taken?

Okay, here we go. Check it out.
Yep. He watched the whole thing happen. -- Recognize the beat cop?

He walks out on his own party. Half an hour later, the Caped Crusader turns up in full bat-drag.
Sees an execution, freaks out in an alleyway. No place to change.
Yeah, Vicki, he's "married" all right.
Oh? Why is that, Vicki?
... Okay, Vicki, I have a confession to make. I'm the Batman.
Don't believe me? Why not?
Right. And they know him. And that's why it would never occur to them for a minute that their old buddy Bruce puts on a cape at night and goes out looking for --
Your little chum is out of his mind.
Next time you call him up and he can't go out Friday night -- think it over.
Vicki, it all fits. The stuff you're telling me -- the car, the equipment -- somebody's paying for it.
The FBI. You know who's got the FBI computer contract? Wayne Technologies.
The guy's bats all right. He's bat shit crazy. This is gonna be the most incredible --
Not what?
Vicki. We got a wealthy millionaire here... who dresses up like a bat. He goes out at night and swings around -- in his cape -- on a rope.
Okay. Maybe I'm crazy.
Gimme a break. If he wants to chat, he can talk to his car.
Well, when he does you know my number.
Alexander Knox. Gotham Globe.
Actually, I wanted to talk to Batman. Pass that on to Mr. Wayne, would you?
Well, that's how it is, chum. She tells me everything.
Simple. You know the score. One column -- and I can bring all this tumbling down. I can take you off the streets once and for all.
I want you to hang up the suit. And I want you to stay away from Vicki.
Then stay away from Vicki. That's all I want, man. I just want your word.
See, I don't know how it happened --
Because I --
Because she'd never speak to me again.
Come on, Bruce. Be straight. What have you got to offer? You gonna marry her? Batman and Mrs. Batman?
Gimme a break, huh? Who's gonna be Best Rodent?
Yeah, a drink. "Civilized."  Man-to-
VICKI!
Couldn't turn down the job, huh? A girl could get hurt this way.
What do you say? Let's head for the lights.
So much for Underdog.
WHAT HAPPENED?!?
Jesus Christ, the guy's a genius.

COME ON!
GIMME A HAND UP HERE!
GET THE CAR!
HOLY SHIT!!

Holy shit. Holy --
Jesus, Vicki.
Hey Knox, you got a visitor.
This one you might want to dust yourself.

A nice, restful vacation.
I do get hurt.
Nothing I'm at liberty to reveal here. What's new and hot in Gotham City?

No.

Some. I am a rich bitch, remember.
I'm quoting.
All over the world. They say he spends most of the year overseas --
Just what I've heard. Rich.
Women find him magnetic.
That, and the sweet smell of two hundred million bucks.
That's intriguing. They haven't been published yet.
Don't mind my friend. He's a little nervous tonight.
This is an amazing house. I'd love to shoot it sometime.
As far as I know.
Oh. Sorry. I was thinking.
Yum, yum.
I get it. Bruce Vain.
Guess who's got a date with Bruce Wayne.
Peanuts?
Plain or roasted?
Alex, I'm very flattered that you've gone out and done all this research.
I told him yes.

Do you sail?
You do a very convincing imitation.
Mm, this is tasty. What's yours?
... Ginger ale?
... I guess I needed a change.
Have you ever been to Corto Maltese?
We went there once when I was little. I played on the beach. And at nights -- they had a band -- I danced with my father on the hotel patio.
That was Corto Maltese. When the war broke out I had to go back. And I promised myself that this time... I wouldn't look away.
... Terror.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to -- I know it all seems a million miles away, out here on the water, with all this --
Bruce, really, when I say these things I don't mean to criticize you.
I'm happy to talk about something else. I don't want to be depressing.
I'm sorry, Bruce, I have to ask. Are you like this with the other women you know? -- Because I just can't seem to get a handle on this conversation.
-- but it's not fair. I'm half drunk and you're not even --
God. You would.
Come on, Bruce. I just want to get two drinks in you. As an experiment.
... We could try that.
I didn't mean to scare you. I just had to come in here and see it that was really you singing.
"Don't buy sugar -- you just have to touch my cup." Come on. "You're my sugar --"
Bruce, you are such a case.

Poor thing. You should stay off that horse.
... To tell you the truth, I'd just about given up waiting.
Hm hmm. Lunch. Not even dinner.
Okay, I'm a sucker. You sound so much like someone I used to...
Bruce? I know this is silly, but --

BRUCE!!

Not to me. I need a job.

I've seen worse. Much worse.

NO!
WHICH CAR?

Shouldn't we --
What about her? What about the girl?
Can't we --
... A hundred and eight?
Well -- I think you might consider thanking me. You were good as dead.

I won't let you have it.

How do I know you won't keep them all?
... Where are you going to take me?
... How long have I been out?
Well, I've certainly enjoyed it.

I, uh...

He's not crazy.

I'm serious, Bruce. We have to --
... So we just pretend none of this ever happened. We never met. We --

I don't understand it. You can do so much good for people. As Bruce Wayne.
You're one man. You can't save everybody.

Oh, God. I've got to have some coffee or something.
BRUCE!

ALLIE!!

HOLD YOUR FIRE!

Bruce Wayne. -- I've read your work.
